Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and beautiful little hotel with a real Parisian feel”
Reviews.Author: Jadeglp
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were fabulous from general information to recommendations from restaurants to places to go. Hotel is a short walk to the Eiffel tower and the metro is a at the bottom of the road. Room was clean and tidy, despite being a little smaller than preferred everything you needed was there and perfect for the time stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: paul l
Reviews.Content: Ths hotel was selected by one of my colleagues for our business trip. I think it is a good choice. The room size is average by European standards, they offer standard and superior rooms. The hotel had a nice breakfast with excellent croissants, breads, cheese, meats, yogurt and fruit. This hotel also offers free wifi, which is not very common in France. The rooms have safes, which are part of an ongoing upgrade plan. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is a half block from the 8 Metro. While it is great to be near a Metro and a number of cafes, the street is noisy. Rooms in the front of the house have to deal with street lights on all night and car noise. Those in the back of the house appear to be smaller rooms. The lift is microscopic, with barely room for two, let alone luggage. I was not overly impressed with the luggage storage, we arrived hours prior to check in time, the hotel agreed to hold our bags until we checked in after 2pm, though our bags were simply stacked in the corner of the lobby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position - overall good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: laludi
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel is excellent! Walking time from the most important attractions in Paris. You also have metro, taxi and bus stations nearby. Absolutely worth it just for the location! Restaurants and quartier des Invalides very charming just few blocks from hotel door. Clean rooms, friendly staff, honest price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality/price”
Reviews.Author: Bracarense
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and our baby daughter (9 month) stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in mid-March. The hotel is under renovations but they managed to keep them relatively unnoticed. We got a small room (but I think this the standard in Paris) with double bed and a baby bed. This made the space left almost null but we managed to get around. The bathroon was small too but in grat condition. We had coffee/tea facilities available and a flat screen TV. One small/big problem was the lift. Getting inside it with our 2 bags and baby car was impossible - we needed 2 voyages to get everything to our room. We had breakfast on the basement, an old wine gallery very nice and with quite a large variety of options. The best thing about the hotel was its location. 10' walk from Eiffel tour, 15' from Musee D'Orsay and 20' from the Louvre. We were able to go everywhere by foot except Montmatre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and no-frills rooms”
Reviews.Author: iridiscent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very typical European hotel with smaller rooms and a tiny elevator. However, the staff were extremely pleasant and the rooms were very clean. Unfortunately there is no view to speak of from the rooms but step outside and you are only steps away from the subway and blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. There was free wifi in the hotel but it was very patchy and I had to login time and time again. The bathroom was newly renovated and the shower always had hot water. All in all a very pleasant stay, if you get a chance to stay here be sure to check out Rue St. Dominique as there are plenty of restaurants, bakeries, bars and shops. Invalides is a great area and I will be open to staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Not as near the Eiffel as you would think”
Reviews.Author: Dix60
Reviews.Content: A long way fro the Eiffel Tower on foot. Not good for the romantics, but if you want a base that is spotlessly clean and cheap this is the one! Bar Central a great drop off and good food at a reasonable price just up the road - nice shops nearby - perfect for the weekend tourist!

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: MikeJL59
Reviews.Content: Sited just south of the Seine, closest metro being Latour Mauberg on the M8, this is a very convenient place to stay. It is just a short walk to Invalides & the Rodin Museum in one direction and the banks of the Seine/Grand Palais in the other. We stayed room only as we had other events organised. Reception was very friendly and very accommodating. Our room on the fourth floor was a good size (for Paris) with a double bed (really two single beds draped together but at least it worked as a good sized double.) The TV had 1 English channel (BBC world), many french, a few german, italian, spanish and even an arabic and ?chinese channel. The lighting worked well and was adequate. Wifi was apparently available but we did not try it. There was a wardrobe with safe inside and some drawers under the vanity unit. Tea/Coffee making with kettle jug provided with plain biscuits. The en suite had a small bath but still usable, with a shower over...not the best but it worked. The screen was a curtain that kept most of the water inside the bath. The toiletries were no more that liquid soap in dispensers. Loo. Single wash basin. Hair dryer with integrated razor socket. Towels were OK and sufficient. The room overlooked the rear of the property and so there was little exterior moise and noise intrusion from other guests was minimal. The room had air-con but we forgot to turn it on. Overall this very much as it says on the tin and we would use it again qute happily

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Irwins
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel in the Invalides/Tour Eiffel area close to metro and train station. The room was clean, serviced every day and probably slightly larger than average for Paris. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a small balcony overlooking the Bld del la Tour Maubourg. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel but front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast which seemed steep at 15 euro pp and instead enjoyed the offering at the "Le Recrutement" bar/cafe across the road. Plenty of shops, bars and eateries close to the hotel, and just a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Reasonable value - we booked through a website and paid 357 euro for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: danngkb
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris on the day of our honeymoon from London and I have to say that despite the size of the hotel, the staff you find there are big in service. Great concierge service should you require anything and very very friendly indeed. Being Singaporeans, we did not speak much French and the staff was able to help us with my tour bookings and requests. Breakfast was fantastic and really enjoyed the croissants. In short, the first trip to Europe was memorable and all the more so with the excellent service of Best Western. My compliments to all of you for your dedicated service. Hope to be there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in Paris at BW. EAsy access from airport - Rossybus to Opera station and then metro line #8. Easy access by metro or walking to the major sites in Paris. Hotels room and bathroom were much bigger then a regular european hotel and was clean. Cute balcony over looking the avenue was sweet. When we arrived and checked in only one person was a front desk so we waited for a bit. The front desk clerk provided us the wrong cost (much higher) for shuttle and had to verify in the evening with new clerk as I knew it was 20 euro not 28 euro!! Also, another couple went into our room while we were napping in the afternoon. They were told that they were assigned to this room. They were apologetic and of course left and said the clerk has done this twice already! I had told the clerk in the evening, and he was in shock. Overall, nice location but staff do need to be on the same page on info and have a better organizing system to prevent double assigned of rooms! I got a pretty good deal for 119 euro for this place, regular was 220-250 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a quiet & convenient location, this is for you.”
Reviews.Author: muffin89
Reviews.Content: I know all hotels posted as good location, bit I like this one because it's very close to the Metro. This is in the 7th District, the expensive area where you rarely find cheap accommodations, but there are a lot of reasonable but excellent rest. and bakeries. Rue Saint Dominique & Rue Cler are very close and definitely worth exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Good value of money, good location, clean, old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: CBRchic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and another couple just before Christmas for a couple of nights. Hotel is on wide boulevard with a few restaurants/bistros nearby and local bar further down. Eiffel Tower is about 15-20 mins walk away. Metro line nearby. Staff: reception very welcoming and helpful. Breakfast lady bit gruff but no issues. Breakfast buffet - basic continental and breads etc with assorted juices, teas, coffee etc. Good price for hotel in this area.... would not class it as a 4 star - no luxury extras in bathrooms and rooms themselves although clean were old fashioned and ready for a revamp. For Paris the rooms are not a bad size - decent size bed and storage. We used BT transfers rather than the hotel transfer service from Paris CDG direct to hotel. It was a great service for 120Euros return. Bus is 10Euros each/way and then metro, so BT transfer real value for money. Driver at hotel prompt for return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - clean and cheap accomodation”
Reviews.Author: JoannaB1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend in June 2011 after being recomended by a friend. The hotel was absolutely perfect for our needs - exceptionally clean, comfortable and great value for money. Less than 5 mins walk to Tour Eiffel, but feels removed from the tourist district so you get lovely authentic French restaurants (a great one right next to the hotel) and patisseries. The Metro line is right next to the hotel and we spent four days in Paris, each day we picked up an all-day metro pass to explore a different area of Paris, and would get home at night and take an evening stroll to the Tour Eiffel. I would note that the rooms are quite small, but this I believe is quite standard in Paris, and more than enough space for two people. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine321_11
Reviews.Content: Just returning on 1/5/11 stay in Paris for six days with my nephew. We stayed at the Best Western Tour Eiffel Invalides. The location is perfect, just down the street from the Tour Eiffel. It is on the No. 8 metro line. We travelled around the city by metro, do easy to figure out. The staff at the hotel were so nice, very helpful. I can't remember names but I can say that all the staff from the front desk to the room cleaners to the kitchen staff were nothing but friendly and helpful. The rooms are meticulously clean. We were given a beautful room that was simply decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast is fresh and just what you need to begin a day of touring such a beautiful city. There are several cafe's and brassaires around the hotel that serve the freshest foods for all meals, wonderful coffee or hot chocolate after a full day of touring. What else can I say, good food, friendly/beautiful people and a wonderful city to explore. Thank you Paris for a memoralble visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: MarianaLonghi
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel in Paris we didn't know exactly what to find since we heard hotels in Paris for reasonable prices are easily old and dirty. So based on the comments here at Trip Advisor we booked this hotel. When we got there and realized how great of a location it was we were really happy. It is only 10 minutes walking from the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood is safe and there is a metro station right on the corner. But on most of our 5 days there we walked throughout the city. The staff was really nice (one of the reception guys spoke about 4 languages, including Portuguese which is amazing) and they were always very kind. There was free internet and 2 really good computers downstairs. The rooms were always very clean and didn't smell like old buildings. The only thing was the shower that didnt have much flow of water. Also, the breakfast was good but we didnt think it was worth the 13,00Euros per person so we didn't have breakfast there everyday. Anyways, overall the hotel was excellent for the price and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - worth the supplement”
Reviews.Author: Ausman46
Reviews.Content: Five nights in Paris. Where best to stay? The BW Tour Eiffel in Invalides [7e arrondissement] is the ideal location - 2 blocks from Invalides; 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower; a metro 100 metres away. And Concorde, the Tuilleries, the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay all within a 20 minute walk. The rooms are not enormous, so if you are given a choice always go for the larger one and pay the supplement. We did and ended up with a balcony room overlooking the Boulevarde Tour Maubourg. Recently refurbished, the room was large enough for 2 and all our luggage, had easy chairs to relax in and a desk to work at [Skype home mostly]. Oh, and the wi-fi is free. In addition the local area has many restaurants/bars etc, mini super markets, pharmacies, bakeries etc and you are only 2 blocks from the fabulous street markets of the Rue Cler.

Reviews.Title: “A nice small Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: iresx
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and we quite enjoyed our stay. The hotel is 5 minutes from the Seine River, 15 minutes from the Louvre Museum and 10 miutes from the Eiffel Tower( on foot all this). Our room was quite small but very clean. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast which was not included in the price was quite good for the 13 euros. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again if I visited Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well-placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsDevine
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel if you're in Paris for a few days and want to be near the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Grand Palais etc. The rooms are clean, pretty good size for Paris, and the facilities ok. Breakfast is too expensive - lots of more reasonably-priced cafes nearby to have breakfast. The bathroom we had was ok - the shower didn't work very well but the water was hot! Very friendly management, who were patient with my elderly mother-in-law, who spent a lot of time in the hotel foyer chatting to people. The Casino around the corner is very good for treats and cheap souvenirs, if you like French food, and who doesn't? Slightly oddly, they don't clean the rooms until a bit late in the day, and my son found a pair of someone else's shoes under his bed when we were leaving but the manager very helpfully emailed us when we'd left, asking if they were ours and offering to throw them out for us! One final tip, if you're heading to Paris in the next few days, check first if the Musée d'Orsay is open, as the staff are on strike.

Reviews.Title: “Between average and very good”
Reviews.Author: hotellooker
Reviews.Content: Because we finally found award tickets on "our favorite airline" very close to our departure date, the 4 other BW hotels we have stayed at in Paris were full. So we stayed here in the 7e, which is very central and a nice change from the crowded 6e. The first two nights cost 249 E each, plus breakfast 13 E each. They said that was fashion week, though I can't find those dates on Google. Other nights were 219E. We are used to lower August prices but that's depressing as so much is closed. As other TA'ers have written, this place has its problems- Ran out of hot water most mornings Horrible door banging-especially when kids were visiting back and forth. Inconsistant delivery of towels-what is so difficult about 2 bath, 2 hand and one mat daily? Room often not vacuumed and edges in hallways unvacuumed. Bit of mold around tub. Tub had some scum. If we went out after 11 am our room often uncleaned at 4 pm return. Strange scrambled eggs-seemed made from a powder? TV out over a day, iffy toilet, handle fell off outside of door a few times, safe lock in our first room didn't work so we had to miss sightseeing to move our things [to a much nice room!]. The good things- Location TV magazines, French and English newspapers, Paris Match, etc. always in lobby. Coffee [for euros].There was always a full bowl of tiny candies. Much more hospitable lobby that other BWs. Though breakfast seems pricy to us, the croissants were delicious and there was a lot of choice. But those eggs--odd and invariably stone cold. Staff-all of them [except the woman who slammed the door to the lockers every morning while guests were breakfasting] were unfailingly polite and patient. A lot can be overlooked because of their attitude. However, if this ship were just a little tighter....

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: deb81Brockway
Reviews.Content: The staff made this visit great. When we checked in the hotel manager upgraded us to a larger room, wow! The room was beautiful and the feather cover was nice. We had an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, where we could catch the hop on hop off bus, for an easy day of seeing Paris. Make sure you plan ahead for the shuttle to the airport..and it is not free. We used the cab service and it made the departure a little easier. If I am ever lucky enough to visit Paris again, I will diffidently be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: AnyHerts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend. The reception staff were always happy and friendly and willing to help. The room was great, small, but with everything in. Bathroom plenty big enough. Did not have breakfast there as plenty of cafe and restaurants outside. Very near to everything. Eiffel Tower very near. You can see it from the next road. Rue Cler great for lunch and dinner. Felt very safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel with five star service”
Reviews.Author: fixitforme
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? One of the best hotels we have ever stayed In!! Words like fantastic barely do It justice. I spent weeks trying to find a hotel to surprise my wife for our 25th wedding anniversary and our first trip to Paris, and sure hit lucky to book this one. It is down to the excellent staff and management that made our stay so wonderful, we were made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived by the hotel manager Ylli and his assistant Ismael. Our room was a reasonable size and more than adequate to meet our needs. We had a lovely Queen Size bed, a very large LCD TV, antique wardrobe, dressing table, Desk, occasional table, two bed side cabinets and two arm chairs and still had plenty of room. The en-suite was fully tiled and contained a full size bath with over head shower, WC, wash hand basin and large storage cabinet. Both rooms were decorated and furnished to a high standard but for me the crowning glory had to be the two pairs of French doors leading out onto our private balcony overlooking the charming cafes, bar’s and bistro’s below. The area has plenty of restaurants and bars with every kind of food, from a take away pizza to a more formal dining room experience. Whether traditional, Brazilian, Chinese or gastronomic, there are an abundance of restaurants only a short pleasant stroll away. I would also recommend taking advantage of the hotel breakfast at least once, a truly charming and possibly unique experience. We felt very safe walking around this area at night. The Eifel tower, Grand Palais, L'HOTEL NATIONAL DES INVALIDES or the Place de la Concorde are all within easy walking distance. In our opinion this is a four star hotel with 5 star service. One example of this, Is when I bought my wife a bouquet of flowers and realised we didn’t have a vase to display them, Once again Ismael came to the rescue and delivered a cut glass crystal vase to our room. Once again the management and staff are fantastic!!!! All in all, we are so very impressed with our stay here, that we will definitely be booking this hotel again. :)

Reviews.Title: “I will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: milton13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The triple room was very small, and there was hardly any room to move about. The toilet and bathroom was tiny. We paid euro.215 per night and it was not worth it. The lift too was very small and on the day we were leaving, it broke down and our son had to drag our suitcase down the small staircase from 4th floor. This hotel is ok, if you are alone, cause it's ok for only one person. the only thing it is situated in a clean and quite area and is close to the Eiffel tower, and was close to the stop for the hop-on -buses. We could also hear sounds from the next room, and every time the door was opened outside. The staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced,, hepful personnel”
Reviews.Author: maryefinucan
Reviews.Content: A very good value for the money. Well-located: close to Metro, walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler, nice cafes. The staff was very helpful. The room was quite large (by European standards), clean, and comfortable. Didn't have the breakfast buffet as it was quite pricey and there were several cafes and bakeries nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: gramashari57
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sunday and Eric at the desk showed us the balcony room as we wanted to upgrade. It was so nice. What I noticed was the make up mirrror. It was a great room. Eric was on duty during our short stay and if we needed ice or advice he was there. we had free WI Fi and it worked great. A heating pot in room with coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cookies. The continental breakfast in the morning was a great way to start day. Go to there web site to see the great continental breakfast. By the way AARP made the reservation for us giving extra discount and paying in US dollars. That is a real plus as the exchange rate is bad. This hotel is centrally located and walking distance to the Seine and the Eiffle Tower. We came in from Disneyland Paris ( time with grandkids) and easy train acess. Also easy access to metro and bus system. So many resturants just at your door step. A real treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but friendly and GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: travellingrat
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and spent three nights in the hotels club room. The room was small but we didn't mind as we were expecting it based on previous reviews. My daughters had a single bed in the lounge with a roll under for the second bed. These were very comfortable. The main bed in the bedroom was excellent. Sheets were very nice quality and no issues with the cleanliness. Bathrooms (2) - again small, but had a nice shower in one and bath with shower over in the ensuite. Staff - All staff we met were very friendly and helpful. Our French is aweful but all staff there knew English, and were patient with us attempting to communicate while butchering their language. Food - We chose to eat in the many cafes around Paris. Location - Now this is why you would stay here! It is a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and really is in a great part of town. Lots of little super markets close by to get your bread, ham, cheese and wine in on the walk home. Facilities - The room had no wine glasses. Ice was available from reception (along with wine and beer). The room had a nescafe coffe machine (capsules were available from reception at €2 each). WiFi was free throughout the hotel, and there were two computers in reception for guest use (also free). Overall - very good value for money considering the location. I would stay there again if we make it back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a quiet comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Rune1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location with a walking distance to the river, the eiffel tower and invalides. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a bit small, but that was part of the charm of Paris. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris location!!”
Reviews.Author: Dreggy
Reviews.Content: When booking our motel the location was our primary concern. This one fit the bill. It is in relatively easy (for us, we're walkers) walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, The Louvre, Champs Elysees Blvd., Arc de Triumph, and many more sites. There is a Metro (subway) station about a block away for farther journeys. We took a pedometer and logged about 25,000 clicks a day. The neighborhood has many street cafe's, pastry shops, small grocery shops, and souvenir shops for your convenience. The rooms are quite small and housekeeping only average, but the service from the guys at the front desk was outstanding. They went above and beyond to try to help you with your needs. On a side note, if you need washrags, bring your own. Not one hotel we stayed at in London or Paris supplied wash cloths. If you stay here you will pass a street called "Rue Cler" between the hotel and the Eiffel Tower. Take a stroll up this street and you will find a section about 3 blocks away that is for pedestrian use only with all kinds of shops and eating places. The biggest downside to Paris is the cost of hotels compared to what you get, this is no exception, which is why I only give it 3 stars instead of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great local to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: dawnsadventures
Reviews.Content: This Best Western is very close to the Eiffel Tower, walking distance is about 15 minutes brisk walk, we thought from the discription that we would be able to see the Eiffel Tower from this hotel but you cannot. We walked to the Eiffel Tower, which was a 5 hour jaunt the line ups were huge, then it takes you up part way then you have to walk around and line up again then head to top then line up again to go down....just at the bottom across the street is a River Cruise that takes you on a 1 hour tour around all of the main attractions, then you can get off and 15 min brisk walk back to hotel. I recommend doing that cruise at 9 pm as when you return the Eiffel Tower lights up at 10 pm absolutely amazing! The daytime attendant was very nice and took our bakckpacks for us so that we didn't have to carry them all over Paris! he locked them up for us until we returned later to get our room. The nighttime guy was rather obnocious and the room was very tiny but hey, it's Paris, everything there seems to be tiny! Room was clean and bathroom was clean, had a tv and 2 windows that opened onto an extremely tiny balcony that you could barely fit to stand on but again, it was downtown Paris! had 2 twin beds a tiny tiny couch, little desk and a kettle with instand coffee and tea, did I mention very tiny room? very tiny elevator, very tiny hallways, but clean. Oh and there are a few bakeries on the street right across at corner right side out front door, book a shuttle to the airport way ahead in advance, we tried to get one for the next day and were told they were unavailable, we had to take a cab and man was that ever expensive! and long! almost missed our plane!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: AdeleSp1
Reviews.Content: Had very little time to spend in paris.Ismael at front desk showed us where to go to see all the sights and how to get there.All the staff very friendly and helpful.Great location for walking and metro station. Only negative to hotel was the pillows were small and uncomfortable and the shower wasn't very good and there was no air conditioning. We even managed to go to eurodisney for a day .dinner cruise down the Seine was relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & bijoux”
Reviews.Author: RussellERennie
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for the tourist. Only a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and the River Seine. 6 restaurants within 50metres for breakfasts & dinner and the Metro less than 100metres. Rooms may have been classed as small by some other reviewers but they were probably trying to a do a direct comparison against USA size rooms. Lovely central courtyard/garden in which to relax. A perfect hotel and as stated above a great location from where to base yourself in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: tboneman_99
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. The room (ours was just a standard one) was a bit on the small side as seems to be normal in Paris but it was clean and tidy and well presented. The room also came with tea and coffee making facilities which was very welcome and an air conditioning unit. Unfortunately it wasn't warm enough in June whilst we were there to use it ... ! The staff were all great and very helpful, even allowing us to check in early which was a bonus, although they would have gladly looked after our luggage anyway even if the room wasn't ready. The area was nice and fairly quiet and felt safe to walk round even late at night. At least 3 reasonable cafe/bars were within 2 or 3 minutes walk and lots more just 5-10 minutes walk away. The Eiffel Tower was just 10-15 minutes walk away and the Seine just 10 minutes at the most. The bridge over the Seine on the same road is right next to the Bateaux-Mouches cruise boats as well which was great for the dinner cruise we went on. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel as it was quite pricey although that's in line with many hotels in Paris I think. We actually went to the corner cafe just up towards Les Invalides and on the same side of the road as the hotel where you could get coffee, fresh orange juice, croissant and half a baguette plus butter and jam for about 3/4 Euro less. There were cheaper places but you only got a coffee and a croissant so take note of what you get! Overall, very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip....perfect hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicolaandAdam_11
Reviews.Content: Travel to and from CDG Airport - We found the easiest/cheapest method of transfer from CDG Airport was to take the RoissyBus (9.40 euros pp for a single) to Opera (central Paris) then take Metro line 8 to La Tour Mauborg (1.75 euros pp for a single). The hotel is then a short walk from the Metro stop and streets are clearly signposted. Taxis are expensive and the trainline direct from the Airport to near the Hotel is more expensive/less comfortable than an air conditioned bus which runs every 15mins from the Airport. Hospitality - On our arrival the reception staff were polite and friendly offering us a map of Paris straight away showing us how to get to the main attractions. The room was faultless, clean, well decorated and had everything we needed for our short trip. Coffee and biscuits were provided. We had a room on the top floor with a balcony and this was great as we could open the doors to allow fresh air to circulate and the room felt bigger. Our ackage included the buffet breakfast situated in the basement, we would definitely recommend the breakfast as there was something for everyone and filled us up for the busy days ahead!! Again staff very helpful and friendly! Location - We booked our trip to Paris only days before we went leaving us little time to research where it was and how to get there. However once we arrived in Paris it was clear how perfect the location was. We managed to stumble across it using a 10yr old map. As we arrived late int he evening we dropped our bags straight away and headed out for something to eat...only having to walk 50m down the road before finding a perfect restaurant. Not too pricey either. Overall we cant wait to go back and stay at Best Western, it was the perfect hotel for our 3night break to Paris and we loved every second!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the taxi booked by the hotel to take us back to the airport 65 euros!”
Reviews.Author: Foodiefan51
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, clean, good reception staff though the taxi they booked for our return to the airport was held together with sellotape, had a creepy driver and he charged us 65 Euros! Left a bit of a bad taste after what had othewise been an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerZA2602
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The location is very good as everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous time hotel excellent location an friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaretgordon4
Reviews.Content: Great time was had by all superb we had a brill time

Reviews.Title: “I could not have picked a better place to stay. I got very lucky for my first time in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: TrishaCM
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel well in advance on Orbitz.com. I chose it because it looked to be in a decent location for all the sites, clean, had good reviews, and I knew of the Best Western label. I got a very reasonable price too. I stayed in a basic double room and the accomodations were clean and nice. The hotel is in a GREAT location. It lies on a quiet street between Des Invalides and Tour Eiffel (which I went to repeatedly to gape!). It is near Rue Cler, Rue Saint Dominique, and the Subway station. The Eiffel Tour is about a 10 minute walk up a charming street with tons of shops, les boulangeries, and cafes. The hotel itself is clean, charming, and comfortable. They offer a large breakfast and have free wi-fi and even guest computers for checking the news back home or catching up on email. I was able to get an adapter for my cell phone too. What really made this hotel fantastic, though, were the people who run it. They were so friendly, personable, helpful, and kind. The maids, the kitchen staff, and the front desk managers (Yli, Bachir, Ishmael) were outstanding to us - they were patient with my lack of fluent French and they helped us with every aspect of our visit to Paris - directions, maps, shuttles to the airport, miscellaneous questions about sites to see. They truly created a warm environment there. I even met many of the guests too, all from different countries, and it was just a great experience all around. I can't wait to go back. Paris was so beautiful and this hotel was fantastic for my first stay (and the ones to come)!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for sightseeing and large enough room for a family of four.”
Reviews.Author: SportsmomMichigan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the BW Tour Eiffel Invalides, which was booked by a travel agent. We had the top floor club room, which included two rooms and two bathrooms. One bedroom had a queen size bed and the other had a trundle bed. The room also included a stovetop burner, sink, microwave and mini fridge. Mugs, spoons, coffee maker along with coffee, tea, sugar for us to use. There was a in room safe and air conditioning. One bathroom had a shower stall and one had a nice tub. Very clean and modern accommodations. The rooms were kind of small, but we were not in them for long as we were sightseeing most of the day. The location made this very easy as we were within a 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tour, Hotel des Invalides, Champs Elysses, Louvre and Musee D'orsay. This hotel had wifi and a lobby computer for use. It also lent out adaptors for a 30 euro deposit, which was returned to us. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Left Bank hotel made me feel like a parisian for a week.”
Reviews.Author: timeisshort
Reviews.Content: The room, although small by U.S. standards was well decorated with French style furniture. A door opened to a small balcony that allowed views up and down the street. The Bathroom was tiny but was beautifully finished with brand new tile and fixtures. The bed was firm and we slept great. Everyday when we returned in the late afternoon the bed was made and fresh towels were in the bath. Their was always lots of hot water for showers. We always felt like we were in Paris, not a typical boring U.S. hotel. The staff, especially the 4 gentlemen that worked at various times at the front desk were fabulous. Every time we passed thru the lobby we always received a hearty "Bonjour" or "Bonsour". Any time we had a question or needed a direction or tip, they went out of their way to help. The best thing about this hotel though was the location. 2.5 blocks from the seine,1/2 block to metro station, 2 blocks from des invalides and naploeons tomb. Have a drink outside at the corner bar and watch the street action and see the eiffel tower lit up at night. Just 5 blocks to the Rue Cler neighborhood. Overall, we could not imagine a better place to be in the center of incredible Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: kvenzon
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris before I knew exactly what location I wanted when returning. This was perfect. It was my husband's first visit and he loved it. Short walk to Invalides, cafes on every corner, 10 minute walk to the Eiffel. A relatively quiet street. Easy walk to two Metro stops. The staff was so nice. The room was small, but not too. We elected for a balcony facing street. Room was very clean. Around the corner was a small grocery where we could buy wine, cheese, and fruit. Just up the street a small bakery. We enjoyed each evening in the courtyard with our goodies and then still had room for dessert at the nearby cafe. We would definitely recommend and will stay again. For us it couldn't have been better. (Kathi,Ken -Texas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location for first timers and seasoned travelers”
Reviews.Author: PabloDiabloDC
Reviews.Content: We found the BW Tour Eiffel a perfect stay for us in so many ways. It's location in the 7th Arr. couldn't be beat, easy walking to the Metro system (1/2 block), Eiffel Tower, most museums, many restaurants in Rue Cler, and Champs Elysees. The small staff were friendly and helpful. Our package included the buffet breakfast, with incredible WONDERFUL, fresh choices and no limits, and it helped maintain our stamina in long-walking days. Room was small but adequate, clean and quiet, though short on soap. The value was excellent. Would definitely return there if looking in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “So great and so convenient.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small hotel did not disappoint. It was one block from a metro stop, and approximately a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. It was situated on a relatively quiet street lined with trees and cafes. The staff was so pleasant and helpful. The room was considered a "superior room" which was large for European standards and had a nice bathroom as well. Very pleased with this hotel overall and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Two-star hotel masquerading as three-star”
Reviews.Author: toerist
Reviews.Content: Great location, and comfortable room, if a bit small. But the elevator was not working on arrival, and our room was on the 5e etage (6th floor) by narrow winding staircase. Staff were happy to help, but! Elevator fixed by our third day, but quit again, and not fixed by check-out, even though a full working day (not weekend) had elapsed. One of our key-cards failed (not an uncommon occurrence) but when you've just climbed 5 floors and then have to go down, get new card and repeat process, it's a pain! And not cheap for all that. Facilities and services in France tend to work very well, so this was a throwback. If you go, get a room on a lower floor, just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris location, plus charming style”
Reviews.Author: Millersenvacance
Reviews.Content: A delightful combination of French charm, with some modern niceties such as free wifi internet, made our (2 teenage sons and one mother) stay at Best Western Tour Eiffel Invalides a delight. The room was big by French standards – and with floor to ceiling opening doors to a tiny wrought iron balcony, which overlooked Boulevard La Tour Maubourg Take the tiny elevator or walk out the typical circular staircase to your room. We avoided the breakfast cave ( the room underground where the hotel does their breakfast for 14 Euros) preferring to indulge in a huge breakfast (half a baguette, croissant, fresh juice, coffee or hot chocolate and a ham or ham and cheese omlette for 9 Euros at the La Recrutement Café across the road. Stopped the always hungry teenagers in their tracks. Literally one block to the breathtaking, wide open green expanse of Des Invalides, and a ten minute stroll to La Tour Eiffel in the other direction. The front desk staff were helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Traipsing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in August, 2010. The location is excellent; members of the staff were very cordial and helpful; the room was bright, clean and attractive; and the breakfast was very enjoyable. What more could we ask? We have stayed in a number of tourist hotels in Paris in the past, and this one was among the best. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 3NewEnglander
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it is in the 7th arrondissement, close to the Eiffel Tower. It was an easy walk to the Louvre as well. We stayed in a Club suite which has two rooms. The rooms are small but clean, and we had two full bathrooms. One had a shower while the other had a tub, but it made it so much easier for our family of four to get ready in the morning. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but instead had croissants and beverages at a small cafe near the hotel for about half the price. Parking is not on site, but it is a short drive away; and my husband had no trouble parking our Toyota 4Runner.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mansic
Reviews.Content: Very Small rooms and tiny bathrooms but very authentic and enjoyable. location was perfect .. the area was busy and crowded

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean hotel in great spot”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryoz
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely clean superior room which was quite spacious for Paris hotels. Only downside was the traffic noise was a little bit perceptable as our room was at the front of the hotel. We also ate breakfast at La Moulin de la Vierge around the corner as the basic breakfast was a ridiculous price (as at all Paris hotels). But would definitely stay there again - the location is excellent...just 5 mins walk from Invalides Metro, and comfortable walking to all major landmarks, and to the Bateaubus on the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, Great room!”
Reviews.Author: CeresaM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located down the block from the Eiffel Tower. (From the corner, you can see the tower and then it is only a 1/4 mi. walk down). It is around the corner from the local Metro station and a little more of a walk to the express station that can take you to all of the major stations in Paris. We stayed here for 10 days and were very happy. This was our first time traveling overseas together so we wanted to choose a hotel that was familiar to us, so we went with Best Western. We were not disappointed. The price was very reasonable for what you get. We had heard about the rooms being small but the room was a very good size for the two of us. We faced the courtyard - my ONLY minor complaint would be about the construction that was going on in the building across the courtyard. It made the view a little less. But we are New Yorkers and are used to construction and looking out the bedroom window and seeing another person's bedroom window. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. The hotel is small so they got to know us very well - it was almost like having a doorman. They all spoke English and helped us with directions quite often. They provided us with a converter for the outlets and were just all around nice guys. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: daninicole2787
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, and they had a coffee maker in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Penny-pinching hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: hereweego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, close to the metro (La Tour Maubourg) and the wonderful Invalides. Champs Elysees is about 12 minutes walk, and there are a number of good restaurants close by. So as a base it has plenty to recommend it. However, a number of things about the hotel itself were disappointing. The hotel's website mentions internet access for guests in the foyer, but omits to say that this will cost €7 for 15 minutes. (I passed.) My room (single confort) was exceptionally small, even by Paris standards, and the wardrobe was a joke. The choice of TV channels didn't include Canal +, which meant no access to live coverage of sports events. The furnishings were cheap. The Yellow Pages, which I have always found useful in other Paris hotels, was notable by its absence. The safe in my room was not keypad-touch, but manual lock. I paid a €30 deposit for the key (refunded on check-out), which I had to guard throughout my week in Paris. The safe was located at ground level, which wouldn't be ideal if you had a back problem. On two days the water in the shower was cold. On the first occasion I was told at reception that when all the rooms in a section of the hotel were not occupied, it was difficult to manage the water supply(!). The second time my complaint was dealt with much more professionally and there was no further difficulty. While breakfast was adequate, the coffee was pretty ordinary and was not made to order. The vault in which breakfast was served was very dark. Despite these drawbacks, I enjoyed a lovely week in Paris. The hotel was clean and comfortable, but I've stayed in better, less penny-pinching 3-star Paris establishments that cost less.

Reviews.Title: “somewhere to crash out...”
Reviews.Author: squigglestick
Reviews.Content: good points, Location - great location and possible to walk to all the main attractions that paris has to offer. Hotel itself is really a place to sleep, although depends on the other guests !!.. had a very sleepless night one night and couldnt have lasted another night ...lift is quite noisy also other guest's room are very close together and voices and doors /toilets flushing etc., can be heard . doors have a very large heavy hinge on and however considerate I was being closing the doors, they have a knack of slamming shut ..VERY LOUD... Tea/ Coffee sachets in room although only 1 a day, and 1 small plastic milk.. I did ask for more pillows for bed, and on my return from a day out ..I had 1 extra waiting for me, would have been helpful if they had a few extra available in cupboard if needed. Breakfast continental style in basement packet cheese / ham & bread rolls. jams. tea coffee available - although breakfast lady did seem to hover over shoulder so you do feel a bit guilty if you have a larger appetite in the morning. Overall a great location, so fine if you just need somewhere to put your head.

Reviews.Title: “best (western) stay near eiffel”
Reviews.Author: trippletrot
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris from 10 - 13 April 2009. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was neat and clean (which is the most important aspect for me!). We requested more towels when we returned from our first city site-seeing as we were 3 people sharing but were provided with a set of towels for 2. The staff member on duty provided these within a short time from making our request (although it was almost midnight at the time). When making our booking we requested a room with a street view. We did get such a room - it made our stay more memorable as we could enjoy the early morning and late night street life in La Tour Maubourg. This is a more quite street, though! If you seek vivid night life it is not the place to go! The windows and thick curtains shut out most sounds from outside. We even slept late because of the curtains shutting out the early morning light. Being able to leave our luggage at the hotel on the last day of our trip allowed as to fully utilise the day without the burden of taking our suitcases along! The hotel is near the Eiffel, Metro and close to some shops and restaurants. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel but enjoyed croissants from a nearby pattisier. We recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris - ruined by incredibly noisy hotel at rip-off price”
Reviews.Author: HealthAngel
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my first ever visit to Paris. After deciding to go for a five-day city break with my boyfriend, we read a lot of reviews and spent a lot of time choosing a good hotel in a good location. I am sorry to say I was incredibly disappointed, I feel very ripped off for the price it was and indeed the hotel had such a negative effect that it ruined my overall holiday experience. The Best Western is in a great location, but that is where the positive ends I'm afraid. We stayed on the fourth floor, with a double bed made of two singles pushed together. The room was clean and the bathroom functional and I could have lived with it, had it not been for the very high levels of noise. The hotel has a lift running up its centre, which slowly squeaks its way to the floors each time it is used. The bedroom doors are in many cases just inches away from each other and closed by a strong hinge, causing the whole room to shake each time anyone used them on any floor. Even ear plugs were no match for the lift or the very loud door bangs - so much so it made no difference at all having them in. There was also a periodic down-pour of vast amounts of water at random times of the night from the floors above. The whole air conditioning system had also been turned off by the hotel, so with the stuffy heat you had the choice of putting up with the stiffling heat or adding even more noise by having to open the window to the road noise below. On a city break you go to sight-see, do a lot of walking and generally just rely on a hotel as base to sleep in. For 157 euros a night, I expected even at the most basic of levels to be able to sleep - but it just proved impossible here. After a couple of nights of hardly any sleep I was feeling quite ill and this took away from my enjoyment of being in a place as wonderful as Paris! Other things about the hotel to note - The internet is only free if you bring your own laptop with you. Otherwise it is a mindblowing 7 Euros for 15 minutes to use it! We were told that the air conditioning was not available as this time, as they have turned the whole system off. Not a major thing, but one of the reasons we chose the hotel was because it marketed itself as having fully airconditioned rooms. I would strongly recommend other travellers to avoid this hotel. There are others in an equally good location but with better prices and service. I didn't have high expectations, but even my low expectations have been far exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and price!”
Reviews.Author: etbwatson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was very clean and had a window that opened into a courtyard. The front desk staff was very helpful and the hotel was in a good location for walking to most sites like the Eiffel Tower, Le Louvre and Notre Dame. We loved the "La Source" Care that was down the block on the corner and ate there more than once!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: marcudo
Reviews.Content: Although the general feeling is positive there were a few things that had spoiled it. When I arrived at my hotel on the first day, I found couple of tea-bags, coffee sticks and sugar sticks waiting for me on a hospitality tray in my room. I used them very quickly and was dissapointed they hadn't been replenished afterwards. I had to go to the reception desk and ask about some more tea-bags and sugar sticks TWICE during my 4-nights stay, though they shoud have paid attention to that after my first visit (?). When I asked about more tea-bags for the second time I was handed 1 (ONE!) tea-bag, although there was two of us - my and my girlfriend - in the room. When I asked a receptionist about ordering a pizza for me, he told me where the pizza-house is and send me there myself!!! There was an information about possibility of ordering a breakfast to the room. I tried to be nice and not bother anyone of doing it - therefore I decided to go to the dining room myself and take the breakfast upstairs, as my girlfriend wasn't feel well enough to go for breakfast to the dining room herself. When I was filling the tray with baquettes, yoghurts and another stuff, the "breakfast lady" who was in charge of the place came over to me and informed me that in fact I am not allowed to take the breakfast upstairs to my room, but she lets me do it this time!! And last thing: I needed to organise a transport from the hotel to the airport. I came down to the reception and give them all details about where and when I need the transport. The receptionist wrote down everything and then he made a call. Unfortunatelly there was no-one to answer, as it was evening time. The message from the answering machine said in english: "Please call us tomorrow, we are open from 7 am". I asked the receptionist if he can do it tomorrow or if he could hand it over to someone who would be there tomorrow to sort the thing out. Surprisingly the receptionist told me to come down to the reception myself tomorrow morning and ask about it once again to his collegue, just like he wasn't bother to deal with it. The knowledge of english language among the hotel staff is just satisfactory, but I also had to deal with one person who didn't know a word in english. The breakfast itself was very poor and there was not a big choice of what to eat. The breakfast lady would stand nearby and watch me when I was filling my breakfast tray, apparently not very happy if I took too much in her opinion, making me feel stressed and guilty at the same time. Apart from all above, the time spent at the hotel was good. If you can cope with situations like the ones described above then you will enjoy it. Anyway it was good value for the price i paid, giving that it was busy new year's eve-new year period.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and quaint”
Reviews.Author: cocomooloolaba
Reviews.Content: This place is a little gem. Couldn't get over our luck as we found it on Trip Advisor. 10min walk to Eiffel Tower, 15mins Champs Elysees and surrounded by restaurants. Come out of the front entrance, turn right, and 1st right again and about 50metres down, there is a mini supermarket. We don't speak any french but it didn't seem to matter. (they all seem to speak english) We are in our early 60's and had a ball and now realise we should have done these trips years ago. (arthritis) Back to the hotel. Beds are great but we read in one review about a year ago not to go for a standard room, but to get a superior one. This was quite large with our king size bed and a single bed opposite. Big bath to soak in after walking around doing the tourist things. Sure, the building is old, but it is beautifully kept and CLEAN. Breakfast underneath in the wine cellars was very good. If you ask for an omelette, say how many eggs you want it made with or it could come out HUGE. I swear mine must have been 4 eggs. Lovely

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Tour Eiffel Invalides! DM from Dublin,Ireland”
Reviews.Author: larmo
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel the ideal starting point for enjoying paris!!!Just back from a long weekend away with my girlfriend. i would seriously recommend this hotel to anyone who was planning a trip to paris. the rooms were small but that wasnt a problem as we didnt spend much time in them but they were comfy. the staff in the hotel were extremely courteous and helpful, from the cleaning ladies to the staff on the reception desk. the room for the 3 nights was not at all expensive compared to other paris hotels in the surrounding area. we didnt sample the breakfast but there is many quant cafes beside the hotel. the main sellin point for this hotel was the great location. a minute stroll to the metro yet you dont have to take the metro as the hotel is in a prime locattion a 5 minute leisurely stroll to the eiffel tower and not even a ten minute walk to the champs elysee. another plus is that the beautiful hotel des invalides is actually around the corner. a lovely hotel in a fantastic location! also nice bottles of champagne upon request at the reception!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and smoke free hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MCC1986
Reviews.Content: My husband took us to Paris to celebrate my 40th birthday. This was our very first trip to Europe as we had been travelling annually to Asia for the last 10 years; hence Paris was a wonderful "beginning" to our next 10 years of travel around Europe. Hotel was very clean, even our room (#43) which was located right next to the elevator, was not noisy. The air con blew in our faces at night so we opened the windows instead. It was hot in July but bearable in the evenings. I had a bit of a medical glitch but the staff were very efficient in locating an English speaking doctor 1/2 a block away. The one thing missing was a mini-fridge in the room, but a few small supermarkets were close by to buy cold water. Another small glitch was the issue of whether we were able to store our luggage since we left Paris to travel to the south of France and returned 7 days later to this same hotel in Paris but it got sorted out and were able to leave one of our bags. Lots of restaurants and bakeries close by for yummy chocolate croissants for breakfast! There's also a couple of sushi restaurants for the diehards! The area is fantastic and we would definitely stay at this hotel again. Thank you to Alain, the manager, you run a great team of helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sharonbstringer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the eiffel tower and easy walking distance to other attractions. Metro station is a 2minute walk from hotel. The area is beautiful, nice cafes and shops. The hotel itself is clean comfortable(so glad of the air conditioning) and quiet. Our room no.25 was overlooking the inner courtyard so no noise from traffic. The staff were friendly and always had a warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: basquegal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous trip to Paris. I booked a room online through Best Western's website and got a great internet rate. (.Good room rates are hard to find in Paris). Our room was very neat,clean and obviously recently remodled as all the furnishings were newly updated. I asked for a room with a view and received a room on the 5th floor overlooking the Boulevard. It was the best. I felt like we were living in our own PArisian neighborhood. We even found a Starbucks within walking distance and a great little creperie as well. The eiffel tower is a very short walk in a very safe neighborhood. The metro station is one block and very easy to utilize. The hotel staff was extremely friendly, helpful and spoke vey good english. All the sights were easy walking distance. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: MrsO_75
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here as was on a business trip and it seemed that every hotel was fully booked. The hotel was dirty - bathroom had hairs on the floor, it smelt and was generally unpleasant. I'd never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pauldalton
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great location. Room was small but clean. Plenty of Cafe's around. Internet was available. Staff were very helpful and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katiejamesteh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Less than a block away fom the metro and has affordable restaurants and bakeries in this neighborhood. DO NOT try the breakfast for 13 euros it's a rip-off and you don't get much for the money. Instead, walk up the street to a bakery and buy some fresh chocolate croissants to save money on breakfast. The eiffel tower is within walking distance from the hotel and all the other spots (museums and etc.) are just a short metro ride away. Do yourself a HUGE favor and don't eat at the restaurants close to tourist spots, you will pay way too much money. The only complaint I had about this hotel was that there were major renovations started halfway through our stay which started as early as 7:30 in the morning and continued all day long. The elevator was out of service for a couple of days which was only a small inconvience, but we already had our luggage in our room. Also, the internet IS NOT free and is 7 euros for 15 minutes on an extremely slow computer, so if you need to be on the computer a lot, bring your laptop! The bathroom was clean but the toilet and sink barely frushed/drained. The two twin beds were comfy. Despite these small discrepancies, the hotel itself isnice and the air conditioning in the room worked great. The staff speaks english and with the exception of one lady, was very nice. Great for the price, just make sure the renovations are finished if you plan on staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Savanah26
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that the location was the best! It was mere steps to a Metro station, great cafes and bakeries around ,that seemed to be frequented by mostly locals. The hotel was under renovations, which we were not told about and we were asked to change rooms midway thru our stay. Normally I would not have a problem with that, but we were asked to do so as we were dashing out the door, about to be late for the tour to Versailles. Our new room was much smaller and the toilet took 5 flushes to work, and the sink was VERY slow to drain...don't accept room 33. The staff, excluding one woman, was extremely kind and helpful. Our luggage was lost for 2 days, and they had tooth brushes and toothpaste for us, which was a relief. Don't purchase the breakfast...not worth it for 13 euros...go to the great bakeries around. I would definitely stay here again, as long as there were not major renovations going on. Overall it was a good experience, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bosley60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value for the price. The rooms are rather small but the staff speaks English and will help you find what you need (we needed a battery for our travel alarm clock). The breakfast is nothing fancy but a nice array of bread, pastry, juice, etc. When we went, even with the in-room air conditioner on, we still slept with the window open as it got quite stuffy. Nice location - walking distance to the Eiffel Tour and not far from the nearest Metro station. Like I said, nothing fancy but good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms - GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: jeniferlynphoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights end of July - early Aug 2005 for our 5 year anniversary (delayed honeymoon!). We really enjoyed it. The hotel is cute and quaint and although they were renovating it, it was still clean for the most part. Everything about it is small - the breakfast area, the rooms, the elevator - but we didn't mind at all. The front desk staff was polite and dealt with my broken French until we switched to English. They helped us many times and were never rude at all. Like others, our room was tiny with barely enough room to walk around the bed and the bathroom was so small you couldn't close the door if you were sitting on the toilet. Yes, the TV only gets French stations....you ARE in France. But we were only in our rooms long enough to crash (and we crashed HARD from all our walking/sightseeing!). We only had one problem and it was that the AC broke 1/2 way through the night one night (in July!). They promptly moved us to another room (which had 2 single beds, but was definitely bigger). We didn't eat breakfast there at all, so I can't comment - rather, we chose to get up, get out and take a new route around the city looking for a place to eat. I think the #1 thing you MUST remember when looking into this hotel is that you are booking a cheaper hotel in another country. Rooms are smaller and service is different. If you leave your attitude at the door and just enjoy the city, you will have a GREAT time and this is the perfect place to rest your weary feet between excursions!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Summerchill
Reviews.Content: Great location... really great staff. Rooms, well not close to what you see on their site and small and quite average. Location is superb not because of the area which is ok but because you can walk everywhere from there! Internet in the rooms a bit iffy but works great in the lounge which is always empty so good place to do what you gotta do! We enjoyed our stay but don't use the restaurants in the immediate vicinity, stroll out about 15 minutes and find much better fare. Staff very helpful in booking things and giving directions and very friendly... yes in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: TinaSFUSA
Reviews.Content: Great location, half a block walk from LaTour Mauborg metro stop. Hotel has friendly, helpful staff; helped us book a tour to Giverny and our shuttle service to the airport. Our room was small room and has no minibar -- so no refrigerator for your perishables and water. We were concerned about a posted comment regarding paper-thin walls. We could hear our next door neighbor's shower running but that's about it. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: parislover_7
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel this is. Rooms were clean, fresh sheets and towels every day and staff friendly. Room and bathroom small but comfortable and great value for Paris. Will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LMLevicki
Reviews.Content: Great location--within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Champs-Elysees. Great bakery on adjacent street which has nice breakfast options and coffee. Front desk staff was really helpful in finding places to eat and the easiest route to get there. I spoke French with them but heard them speaking English with others. Extremely close to Tour-Maubourg metro stop--very convenient! Room was clean--if small, but completely fine for spending only sleeping time there. Bathroom was clean and nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: certifiedtraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in room 31 which faced the street but doublepane windows blocked noise so I had no problem sleeping. The beds (two twins) pushed together to make a king were confortable and firm. The shower tub was adequate with lots of hot water. There was also a kettle in the room with tea and coffee. The elevator is small but pretty quick and no problems getting it to work. I was with a group three of the four were able to get into their rooms that morning of arrival. . but the 4th was much later in the day before it was ready. Breakfast was not included so we went to one of the close places either the night before for yogurt and pastry or got out and took breakfast as needed. The best thing is the location. It is easy walking distance to the RER and Metro PLUS lots of places to eat within in a 2 block distance. I will recommend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: harblinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather small (as many hotels in paris are) but is a little gem in a very quiet and pretty street. The staff were very friendly, with adequate English-speaking ability. They quickly and politely sorted out a booking mix-up (they had "lost" one of our reservations) and they always made a point of greeting us as we arrived and left the hotel each day. The rooms are very tiny but are clean and bright (we were only the rooms long enough to wash and sleep). We were lucky enough to have a room on the front of the property which meant we had a sort of balcony 1 person could stand on to watch the world move by below. Breakfast is extortionate and not worth the bother, a far better option is to stop at one of the many boulangerie on R St-Denis just 200 yards (2 minute stroll)away. Very handy for the Metro you are about 200 yards from Latour-Maubourg and 500 yards (5 minute stroll) from Invalides. It'll take about 30 minutes to walk to the Eiffel tower from here. There is no restaurant and no proper bar but to be honest in Paris you are best going to a real bar or bistro instead! We paid just 53Euro a night, making this place a superb bargain. I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SCCCreceptionist
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Friendly Staff, had suite (still very small) Tub in Master bedroom was great! Stayed 2 nights in February--I know what took so long to review... Had wonderful time. Paris was the best part of our Europe vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend in a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevonRlc
Reviews.Content: Returned on Tues 30th Jan after 4 night stay here for wifes 50th Birthday. Support all other reviews highlighting great position in terms of sights and getting around on Metro & links to RER, in fact I dont think could be much better. First trip to Paris and preferred to walk to see the sights. This hotel is an ideal position for that. We found the hotel to be comfortable, clean and staff friendly and helpful. Rooms small? - Not really. They are adequate with good storage, good size bathroom. If you want to have a party in them then might not be big enough but as a base for the night what the heck do you need any more space for. Take others point about hearing things in neighbouring rooms but not really a big deal. As for breakfast - perfectly ok. I must admit I wouldnt pay the extra 13 Euros for it but as it was in the booked price wasnt going to turn it down. There was always sufficient & yes breakfast room is small but never full up while we were there. All in all I would recommend to anyone, I would be quite happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Our opinion of this ilkeston coop travel hotel”
Reviews.Author: spoony77
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this hotel is more 2 star than 3 with tiny rooms and a few things lacking. The location is the best thing being in a nice quiet area near the eiffel tower and only 200 yards from the essential metro underground service. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful with good english spoken. The breakfast however is terrible and i would avoid this if possible as it consists of bread (they ran out on 2 of our 3 days)and pastries and very little else. There are also only about 6 tables in the breakfast room which if the hotel was full i could imagine being a problem. The walls were paper thin too and we were woken at early hours by people showering close by. Fine for a budget hotel but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Decently-priced hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shoesinks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in Paris in September 2004. For the price, we thought it was a good deal. Room was a decent size. The location was the best part about the hotel. There were a lot of nice restaurants on the streets surrounding, and a few good breakfast spots. The walk to the Eiffel Tower was not too long. And it was very close to the train and subway stations, which made it extremely easy to get around. The elevator was very tiny and slow, only 2 people with luggage could fit in it. But overall, the location was great, and the place was clean. I would stay here again (unless I win the lottery before our next trip to Paris :) )

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsCunnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and enjoyed the experience. The location was great, the metro being just down the road, however we did notice another Best Western on the Champs Elysees which in our opinion would be a much better area to stay in should we visit Paris again. The rooms were excellent, very clean and comfortable, very much to my standard, although a little small, they were adequate, heard no noise and got a good nights sleep. My only concern was on arrival, the receptionist remained on the telephone for over 20 minutes without acknowledging or at least apologising to us, this, my husband and I found very rude. However when she did finally replace the receiever, she was very polite but the 1st impression of her had already been shown! Overall I would recommend a Best Western Hotel should they all be like the one we stayed in.
